greyshed.lib

Class RobCom

  • java.lang.Object
    • greyshed.lib.RobCom

  • public class RobCom
extends java.lang.Object
    Provide methods for communicating with UR Robots (Ethernet) and ABB Robots (Serial/Ethernet)
    +Example
    import greyshed.lib.*; //import the library

ShapeMethods sm;

PVector pt = new PVector(20,20);
PVector center;

void setup() {
  size(200,200);
  sm = new ShapeMethods(this);
  center = new PVector(width/2,height/2);
}

void draw() {
  background(0);
  PVector rotatedPt = sm.rotatePoint(pt, center, PI);
  strokeWeight(10);
  stroke(255,0,0);
  point(rotatedPt.x,rotatedPt.y);
}

    • Constructor Detail

      • RobCom

        public RobCom(java.lang.String botType,
              java.lang.String comType)
        Initialize with robot brand type and communication protocol
        Parameters:
        botType - the brand of robot (i.e. "ABB" or "UR")
        comType - the variety of communication to use. "testing" for none, "socket" or "serial"

      • RobCom

        public RobCom(PApplet theParent,
              java.lang.String botType,
              java.lang.String comType)
        Initialize with robot brand type and communication protocol
        Parameters:
        theParent - Processing PApplet ("this")
        botType - the brand of robot (i.e. "ABB" or "UR")
        comType - the variety of communication to use. "testing" for none, "socket" or "serial"

        Parameters:

        public void waitTime(float sec)

        Parameters:

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(float velTcp)
        Set the linear speed for subsequent moving commands
        Parameters:
        velTcp - the speed in mm/sec

      • setZone

        public void setZone(float pZoneTcp)
        Set the zone data (blend radius) for subsequent moving commands
        Parameters:
        pZoneTcp - the zone radius in mm

      • setAcceleration

        public void setAcceleration(float pAcceleration)
        Set the acceleration for subsequent moving commands
        Parameters:
        pAcceleration - the acceleration, in m/sec^2 (in mm/sec^2 according to the UR manual, but seems wrong. Units to confirm) also note that the manual states that moveJ acceleration values are defined in deg/sec^2, but we don't distinguish types yet be aware of this unit difference if you get strange results with moveJ commands

      • moveJDegrees

        public void moveJDegrees(float d1,
                         float d2,
                         float d3,
                         float d4,
                         float d5,
                         float d6)
        add a moveJ command to the buffer using degrees for each axis
        Parameters:
        d1 - axis 1 degrees
        d2 - axis 2 degrees
        d3 - axis 3 degrees
        d4 - axis 4 degrees
        d5 - axis 5 degrees
        d6 - axis 6 degrees

        public void setTool(Pose toolDat)
        Sets the TCP for subsequent moving commands using a Pose that defines the tooltip in tool space
        Parameters:
        toolDat - the pose defining the tool

      • setTool

        public void setTool(java.lang.String toolDat)
        Sets the TCP for subsequent moving commands using a string that defines the TCP location in the robot specific language
        Parameters:
        toolDat - the string defining the tool (i.e. "p[0.03459,-0.03827,0.11576,0.0000,0.0000,0.785398]" for UR)

      • closeGripper

        public void closeGripper()
        Adds a command to close the gripper to the buffer. If using a different setup, change the command with setGripperCloseCommand("blah blah");

      • openGripper

        public void openGripper()
        Adds a command to open the gripper to the buffer. If using a different setup, change the command with setGripperOpenCommand("blah blah");

      • setGripperOpenCommand

        public void setGripperOpenCommand(java.lang.String cmd)
        Sets the default gripper opening command to a provided string (i.e. the necessary code in the specific robot language) linefeed added automatically to the end

      • setGripperCloseCommand

        public void setGripperCloseCommand(java.lang.String cmd)
        Sets the default gripper opening command to a provided string (i.e. the necessary code in the specific robot language) linefeed added automatically to the end

      • suck

        public void suck()
        Adds a command to turn on suction. For a different setup, change the command with setSuctionOnCommand("blah blah");

      • releaseSuction

        public void releaseSuction()
        Adds a command to release suction. For a different setup, change the command with setSuctionReleaseCommand("blah blah");

      • setSuctionReleaseCommand

        public void setSuctionReleaseCommand(java.lang.String cmd)
        Sets the default suction release command to a provided string (i.e. the necessary code in the specific robot language) linefeed added automatically to the end

      • setSuctionOnCommand

        public void setSuctionOnCommand(java.lang.String cmd)
        Sets the default suction on command to a provided string (i.e. the necessary code in the specific robot language) linefeed added automatically to the end
